mcp_methods.custom_description: To retrive all the charts, pass {}, retrive all the charts only if you were asked to, otherwise, try filtering it by dataset, chart name, chart type, etc. do not use "opr": "in" in filters!!! After retrieving the chart information, use the dataset tool to get the actual database object names.
To retrive all the dashobards, pass {}, retrive all the dashboards only if you were asked to, otherwise, try filtering it by dashboards name, chart name, etc. do not use "opr": "in" in filters!!!

To retrieve all datasets, pass {}; do so only if explicitly requested, otherwise filter by dataset/database name, etc.; do not use "opr": "in" in filters!!!; for specific tables, note they may be in virtual datasets (somewhere in sql code, use "opr": "ct"), ensure exact reference (e.g. for schema.name, schema_test.name_test won't work but maybe is worth mentioning).
